sentences.sContent: I’ll excuse you this time, but don’t be late again.
sentences.sCn: 这次我原谅你，但别再迟到了。
请原谅，我的字写得不好。

sentences.sContent: Can I be excused from swimming today? I have a cold.
sentences.sCn: 我今天能不游泳吗？我感冒了。

sentences.sContent: ...The point is not to excuse or forget the crime...
...But the fact that such a violation is "unintentional" does not excuse the misconduct...
...I guess he'd forgotten he used the same excuse when he called his boss from my house...
...Not only had he lied but his excuse wasn't a very convincing one...

synos.tran: 作为借口；请求宽恕；表示宽恕

phrases.pCn: v. 为自己辩解；请求免除；请求准予离开
(对不能出席社交聚会等)表示抱歉(或遗憾)

words.tran: 可原谅的；可辩解的；可免除的

trans.tranOther: to forgive someone for doing something that is not seriously wrong, such as being rude or careless
a reason that you invent to explain an action and to hide your real intentions
